intro: Austroeupatorium, commonly known as New Jersey tea, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pale yellow to white composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Austroeupatorium is known for its ability to thrive in wet conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
